This is just my humble opinion and two cents is about all it is worth.

Pretty cool little dive type bar across the street from the Hard Rock. It is located in a  strip type mall area. Nice patio area outside to chill with tv's. Ordered some wings which were hot and juicy. Love that they have buckets of beer. Can't go wrong there. I wish i could give more info about the place. It seems like a hip spot as I also ran into some other friends that grew up in Las Vegas here. Check it out.

Might be considered a good sports bar, but the food is not Mexican food. It is the worst food I have eaten in awhile. I won't even break it down plate by plate. It all was horrible. The waitress was nice.

Fun and tasty! Not a fan of their rice or beans, however their shrimp burrito was amazing. 

Their drinks are really good too!
It was a fun casual bar that we found. We enjoyed the food drink and atmosphere. Stopped by twice during long weekend.from Minnesota.

I come here at most twice a month for film events/kickbacks and birthdays. The drinks are a bit pricy though and the food isn't that grand but the staff is so friendly and attentive and Mondays are karaoke nights!!! I love the fact that every wall has tvs so I can keep an eye on sports while I chat

Dive bar to beat all dive bars!  This place needs to move closer to my house!!!  

On our way to drop off some family at the airport we were a little early so we decided to stop in for a drink of 2.  It was happy hour and ALL drinks are buy one get one.  No matter what the drink is!  Considering I drink Grey Goose or Kettle I was a little surprised.  All drinks we ordered tasted great and they did not skimp on the booze.  Not to much and not to little.

Great vibe serving up mexican food and great tasting drinks.  Our total bill for a total of 12 drinks in total was $54.  Where in Las Vegas can you get drinks this cheap??  Service was great.  She was pleasant and very friendly.

This is a UNLV bar so it's near and dear to my heart!  We will be back, rest assured!

The is pretty good, the just don't give you much of it.  The beer is bottled and thus just like everywhere else.

The exception, Taco Tuesday.  TT is a great deal for both beer and tacos.

Overall just bad.   The service was not great.   The chips, salsa, queso, guacamole cost $10 and all of it lacked flavor.  $10 for 3 chicken tacos which were absolutely tasteless and the chicken was extremely dry and lacked any seasoning.  I got a side of black beans because your meal doesn't come with anything and they tasted like they were out of a can.  The draft beers came in plastic glasses and weren't very cold.    Never again.

Come here for a drink and a break from the sun... and from high casino prices. This place is a Tequila bar and has a selection of margaritas to choose from. Cassidy was really really nice with a pretty little face. We enjoyed chatting with her about how living in LV was. Looks like this place literally is a little slice of cheesy Tijuana beach bar. The food was Meh... so Cassidy and her smile really won it for us. 

Come here for drinks... not so much for food.

I love Vegas!  Even after a loong night of shaking our booties, we found several joints open for late night munchies.  It was 4 a.m. and we stumbled in from partying it up at Body English across the street.  

We waited awhile before our server came over.  Apparently, there was only one server and one bartender.  Service was very slow, but she was super sweet.  We had the Nachos with Carne Asada.  It was just average but the beef was tender and the serving was huge.  Although we were trying to recover, I must admit, we were tempted by the drink specials.  

For all you SoCal people, this place resembled Chronic Cantina.

What a great surprise. Just minuets off the strip, a bunch of Sports TVs and great Latin - Mexican food. We ordered chips and salsa, plus guacamole. The guac was over the top in taste & texture.  

We shared large servings of  chicken enchiladas on blue tortillas. An explosion of taste.  Great beans and rice with a home cooked flavor. Large servings.  Good drinks  - several selections of beer and drinks.
I love this place,  I always come here for happy hour - 2 blue moons for the price of 1!! The food is bomb too. Great service,  great atmosphere.  And they have a few machines to play
One of our favorite places to grab a few evening primers, 2 for 1 beers and margaritas! It's nothing fancy, but we always have fun. It's not where you're at, it's who you're with.

Hands down the best happy hour in Las Vegas. Everyday from 4-8 pm you can get buy 1, get 1 drinks. Also the wings go great with the cocktails. The bartenders there are amazing & totally friendly. The music could be better but it's okay. At first you'll be hesitant because of the location and appearance, but definitely somewhere I would take a friend visiting Las Vegas. Such a great time, plus a fun place to pregame!

Two words...happy hour.  One of the best happy hour's in town, 4-8PM, 2 for 1.  A great place to kickstart your night with lots of cheap drinks.  The only food I have ever eaten are the quesadillas and chips/salsa...both were decent.  This review only applies to the bar aspect, food is 3 stars.  Great place to watch football games too.
Jared is the best bartender. Excellent customer service and one of my favorite local bars.
They charge for chips and salsa.  Cockroach came out from under our table so we left.

We should have left immediately when they didn't have toilet paper in the handicap stall even though there were no customers.  It just got worse from there. They served two groups who arrived after us well before they brought our food. Messed up one of the orders and completely omitted another.  No discount except the item that was missed. Terrible service and terrible atmosphere.

I am basing this review from a combination of atleast 5 visits to this place.  I only go this place for a Rebel Game pre-funk or a post Rebel game party.  It is about a 5-10 minute walk to the T & M (of course that depends on how fast you walk).

I stopped there once for a pre-funk and it was pretty much full.  It was evening game and the bar was having happy hour so it worked out perfetcly.  All beers were 2 for 1!  I got 2 dos equis for like $4!

Now... if you stop by here on a post Rebel game night the place will be packed with Rebel fans!  I think the bar gives you a free drink if you show them your stub... ticket stub.  It turns out to be a lively place with cheap drinks!

As far as the food goes... it's more of a drinking place instead of a restaurant, but it serves ok mexican food.  

This is a funb place before and or after the Rebel games!
Service was SLOW and our waitress was so rude we ended up not ordering any food. Not impressed!!!

The only reason I come here is for the crazy happy hour. They have 2 for 1 and a pretty decent selection of drinks you can choose from. They both have to be the same drink though. I would recommend swapping one of your drinks with a friend so you can have two different drinks
Their food is okay, nothing special. The last time that I was here they weren't playing music off of their Touchtunes for some reason. They were playing the radio, which seemed super tacky to me and the commercials were extremely loud. 

 I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come here but it's close to my work and the go to spot for cheap drinks.

Darn good happy hour!  Like for real.  Not only do you get 2 for 1 drinks but it lasts such a long time.  A happy hour that ends at 8pm?  Um yes.  

The margaritas we ordered weren't that great but to be honest I wasn't expecting much so this place has already gone above my expectations.  I ordered 2 Puerto Vallartas at first but the server came back and informed me this was a $30 drink.  If they had the prices on the menu I would not have ordered this but I do super appreciate him warning me (even if it wasn't when I placed the order) and giving me a chance to get a normal margarita.  

We also ordered steak nachos.  Again, I wasn't expecting much.  No these nachos didn't blow me away.  They were pretty run of the mill cheap nachos.  But they weren't terrible so I'll give them that.  I might be biased though because I love all nachos, good and bad.

The service I received wasn't bad at all.  We were seated right away.  Our order was taken right away.  The drinks and food came out quickly.  The server came by and checked on us multiple times.  We got our check quickly.  

I don't know if I'll start frequenting this place but I'm also not opposed to coming back.

Happy hour is a good deal. Crazy hour is probably good too tho I didn't stay that late.  Food is only so-so. 

The restaurant has a Touch Tunes sound system. I logged in. Set up a few songs but the waitstaff and bartender caused it to skip the ones they didn't like. I know because they overly laughed about it with a "oops" and a laugh.  Won't be back.

Close to where I live and the food is nothing but delicious. Only the second time here but nothing like tamales to warm your stomach on a cold evening!! Service is fast, food comes out hot and the service seems to be pretty fast. It's kinda like a hole in the wall Mexican joint that serves a purpose. Decor is everywhere but good to watch games at and relax.

Paradise Cantina is centrally located! It is not far from the strip... so it's great for both locals and tourists.  I would recommend this place to everyone looking for a fun bar with great drink specials!
Great, casual place to have a drink and watch a game with friends or strangers who become friends. It's a cantina, fun and relaxed atmosphere.

Happy hour here I come! How can you not love 2 for 1 drinks and fattening bar food?!

I enjoy the pretzel with spicy cheese sauce as my food du jour. Don't expect haute cuisine, it's just a fun place to meet up with your friends after work to drink and chat. The food isn't amazing, but you're probably just here for the drinks. Stick to pub grub. Wings and queso dip are some good options too.

Keep your expectations low and have fun!

2 for 1 Happy Hour drinks after a long day at the ASD show. Nice atmosphere and food was okay. Waitress was nice but not generous.
I ordered the steak wet burrito which was yummy after a long day at a trade show and my sister ordered the tacos. We were famished and thirsty so this was good on an average level. We then ordered the hot wings to go for later since we knew we were heading straight back to the hotel room to .... sleep!
